thread.title: Trump's first 100 days ... of dominating the polls
thread.title_full: Trump's first 100 days ... of dominating the polls | Washington Examiner

author: Al Weaver
title: Trump's first 100 days ... of dominating the polls
text:
It's now been 100 days, and Donald Trump is still sitting at the top of the mountain.
According to a new ABC News/Washington Post poll, the businessman continues to maintain a healthy lead with 32 percent support among Republicans. The new poll came out a week away from the third GOP debate on CNBC.
In addition, Dr. Ben Carson continues to put a stranglehold on the No. 2 spot in the field with 22 percent backing. Apart from the two outsiders, only Sen. Marco Rubio breaks into double digits with 10 percent support, a three point bump from the previous ABC/WaPo poll before the second GOP debate.
Following up the trio are former Florida Gov. Jeb Bush and Sen. Ted Cruz, who pull 7 and 6 percent, respectively. Carly Fiorina, who has seen her poll numbers fade over the past three weeks, garners only 6 percent.
More from the Washington Examiner Trump: Clinton's Benghazi testimony may disappoint Donald Trump indicated Tuesday night that he's ready to be disappointed by Thursday's Benghazi hearing.
By Kelly Cohen • 10/21/15 8:25 AM Strikingly, Trump leads in almost every category among GOP voters, including strongest leader (47 percent), best chance to win the general election (43 percent), best on immigration (39 percent), and closest on issues (32 percent).
Trump also continues to top the Washington Examiner 's latest power rankings .
Top Story Tea Party Caucus chair: Ryan's conditions 'entirely unreasonable' Paul Ryan's   fell flat with at least one key conservative Tuesday night.
By Susan Ferrechio • 10/20/15 10:18 PM
